info.name: TeamForge 19.3/20.0/20.1 Webhooks-based Event Broker (WEBR) API Documentation
info.description:
WEBR is a webhook-driven message broker delivered as a microservice along with TeamForge. 

The WEBR application is installed by default when you install or upgrade to TeamForge 19.3/20.0. For more information, see TeamForge install and upgrade instructions. 

## Response Codes for WEBR APIs
* Response code 200 means success.
* Response code 400 means authentication failure.
* Response code 404 means page not found. 
* Response code 500 means internal server error.

## HostName Conventions
The {{HostName}} used in the examples can be replaced with something like `https://teamforge.collab.net/webr`. 

You can also use the WEBR port number in the URL instead of `/webr`. For example you can also use `https://teamforge.collab.net:3000`.


Here's the list of APIs supported by WEBR.

request.description:
This API lets you log on to the WEBR application using the WEBR Admin credentials. 

This API takes the WEBR Admin username and password and the response includes a success flag which is either `true` or `false` and a session token.

* You can get the WEBR Admin user's credentials from the `/opt/collabnet/teamforge/runtime/conf/webr/webr.config.json` file. 
* The Admin password is auto-generated and encrypted when Webr is installed as part of the TeamForge installation.

The session token, which is included in the response, is used in the Headers (Authorization) of other WEBR API calls. Sessions inactive for more than 60 minutes expire by default.

response.name: Login
Login

request.description:
This API returns the list of registered pre-submit and post-submit events.

You can pass the eventid_queue with the API call to get the details of a particular event. For example, {{HostName}}/events/v4/{{EventId_Queue}}

request.description:
Use this API to enable extensive logging for WEBR.

You must pass a value, `on` or `off` with the API call to enable and disable extensive logging respectively. 

For example, the following call enables extensive logging. 

`{{HostName}}/instrument/on`

Use this API to create new QUEUE/TOPIC/SYNC type events. WEBR, by default, has a set of pre-defined events. YOu can use this API to create custom events in addition to the pre-defined pre and post submit events. Here's some examples (Body) for creating different types of events using this API.

```JSON
{
            "EventName": "V4EventQueue",
            "EventType": "QUEUE",
            "ContentType": "application/json",
            "EventFormat": "{}"
}
````

```JSON
{
            "EventName": "V4EventTopic",
            "EventType": "TOPIC",
            "ContentType": "application/json",
            "EventFormat": "{}"
}
````
```JSON
{
            "EventName": "V4EventSYNC",
            "EventType": "SYNC",
            "ContentType": "application/json",
            "EventFormat": "{}"
}
````

request.description:
Use this API to get the list of subscribers in WEBR. You can pass the {{subscriberId}} with the API call to get the details of a specific subscriber. For example, the following API call returns the details of the subscriber whose ID is 2001.
`{{HostName}}/subscribers/v4/2001`

request.description:
Use this API to create new subscriptions. 

Optionally, you can add a subscription filter, custom transform script or a custom response script to the subscriptions you create.

For example, the following code snippet creates a subscription with a custom script, subscription filter and Header filter string:
```json
{
"SubscriberId": 2001,
"EventName": "Teamforge.Artifact.Create",
"Description": "Description Delete",
"WebhookEndpoint": "http://{{HostName}}:1000",
"HeaderFilterString": "proj1008",
"SubsFilter": "$$->'Body'->>'paged' = 'true'",
"HttpHeaders": "{\"Authorization\": \"Basic 84848484\"}",
"CustomScript": "v = $inmessage;$outmessage = {EventType: v.event_type,ArtifactId: v.id};"
}
````

response.name: Create Subscription
response.body:
{

        "Description": "This is a create artifact subscription",
        "HeaderFilterString": "",
        "SubsFilter": "",
        "CustomScript": "",
        "WebhookEndpoint": "https://{{HostName}}:1000",
        "HttpHeaders": "{\"Authorization\": \"Basic 84848484\"}",
        "CreatedDate": "2020-01-08 14:37:06.352063 +0530 IST",
        "UpdatedDate": "0001-01-01 00:00:00 +0000 UTC",
        "SubscriptionStatus": ""
    }
}

request.description: This API returns a list of subscriptions in WEBR. Same as the List Subscription API.

Use this API to update a specific WEBR subscription. You must pass the subscription ID with the API call. You can only update the following:
* Webhook endpoint URL
* Description
* Http headers
* Subscription filter
* Header filter string

response.name: Update Subscription
response.body:
{
    "HTTPStatusCode": 200,
    "HTTPStatusText": "OK",
    "Success": true,
    "ErrorText": "",
    "ErrorMessages": null,
    "Response": {
        "SubscriptionId": 26,
        "SubscriberId": 2006,
        "EventName": "Teamforge.Artifact.Create",
        "Description": "Description gets updated for subscription",
        "HeaderFilterString": "",
        "SubsFilter": "",
        "CustomScript": "v = $inmessage;$outmessage = {EventType: v.event_type,ArtifactId: v.id};",
        "WebhookEndpoint": "http://cu024.cloud.maa.collab.net:3000",
        "HttpHeaders": "{\"Authorization\": \"Basic 84848480\"}",
        "CreatedDate": "0001-01-01 05:53:20 +0553 HMT",
        "UpdatedDate": "2020-01-08 14:42:54.887568341 +0530 IST m=+6217.482666699",
        "SubscriptionStatus": "ACTIVE"
    }
}

request.description:
Use this API to activate or inactive a subscription in WEBR. Just pass the subscription ID and a flag, `activate` or `inactivate`, with the API call to make a subscription active and inactive in WEBR. For example:

* {{HostName}}/subscriptions/v4/{{subscriptionId}}/activate
* {{HostName}}/subscriptions/v4/{{subscriptionId}}/inactivate

response.name: Update a Subscription's Status---Active/Inactive
response.body:
{
    "HTTPStatusCode": 200,
    "HTTPStatusText": "OK",
    "Success": true,
    "ErrorText": "",
    "ErrorMessages": null,
    "Response": "Successfully updated status"
}

request.description: Use this API to add or update a transform script to an existing WEBR subscription. The transform script is passed with the API call's Body.

response.name: Update Transform Script
response.body:
{
    "HTTPStatusCode": 200,
    "HTTPStatusText": "OK",
    "Success": true,
    "ErrorText": "",
    "ErrorMessages": null,
    "Response": "Successfully updated script"
}

body.raw:
{
    "comment": "",
    "event_type": "create",

request.description:
Use this API to perform a keyword search on the WEBR inbox messsages. You will be passing the search criteria using JSONB syntax. For example, the following search returns the inbox messages with comments that consist of the keyword "cvb".

```jsonb
$$ %= '{"Body":{"comment":"cvb"}}'
```

Your search query may contain nested conditions in JSONB syntax.

request.description: Use this API to register an endpoint URL that will receive a notification whenever a new subscriber is created via the Create Subscriber API.
Same as Register Add Subscriber API, but is used when an existing subscriber has been updated using the Update Subscriber API.
Use this API to register an endpoint URL that will receive a notification whenever a new subscription is created via the Create Subscription API.
Use this API to register an endpoint URL that will receive a notification whenever an existing subscription is updated via the Update Subscription API.
Use this API to delete an endpoint URL that was earlier registered.
